content:
just read the meeting notes, the benchmarks that are mentioned, can they become part of our canonical sightglass benchmark suite?

  • RFC: https://github.com/bytecodealliance/rfcs/blob/main/accepted/benchmark-suite.md
  • Requirements for benchmark programs to work with our benchmark runner: https://github.com/bytecodealliance/sightglass/blob/main/benchmarks-next/README.md
bytecodealliance/rfcs
RFC process for Bytecode Alliance projects. Contribute to bytecodealliance/rfcs development by creating an account on GitHub.
bytecodealliance/sightglass
A benchmark suite and tool to compare different implementations of the same primitives. - bytecodealliance/sightglass
I think that'd be great, yes! @Shravan Narayan, do you think that'd be possible?
Yup, the jpeg benchmark can be added without too much difficulty. It pulls in libjpeg though; not sure if that's a blocker somehow.
(i.e. a blocker in terms of what people want to have in the sightglass repo)
as long as it is freely distributable, so it doesn't mess up our ability to share the benchmark corpus, we have no problems!
Sounds good. I'll try to put together a cleaned up version of this benchmark later this week, so folks can have a look :+1:
Separately, will also try to locate my early numbers for lucet vs wasmtime
It's ok if you can't find the lucet numbers btw, if the target is %-slower than native that's easy enough to benchmark against
